header.title: The best fence installation company in West Sacramento
bullets: FREE custom 3D fence quotes that you can design, review and edit online!
Responsive, quick and friendly customer service from end-to-end!
Transparent pricing and our quality assurance.
Beautiful, high-quality fences for your property built by skilled local craftsmen.

Yelp.description: I had a tree fall and take out my back fence, so when I needed to find a company to quickly repair my fence Ergeon stepped right up. They were able to do an accurate assessment virtually so I didn't have to wait for someone to come in person. Edgar was my contact and he did an amazing job communicating to me. He also stated the company provides a 5 year quality warranty on their work which is fantastic. I highly recommend Ergeon and will definitely use them in the future if I need any kind of fence work.
Yelp.name: Bryant G.
Yelp.title: I highly recommend Ergeon and will definitely use them in the future if I need any kind of fence work.

Google.description: My experience with Kelly and Samuel was outstanding. Additionally, the staff that came to view and build the fence were great. Professional and easy to work with. Plus, my fence is wonderful! I rarely write reviews and I highly recommended this company!
Google.name: Kimberly K.
Google.title: Professional and easy to work with. My fence is wonderful!

articles.description: If you’re looking to get a new fence in California, it’s important to know about the laws surrounding fences and home improvement projects. Our post will go over some important things to keep in mind.

When it’s time to get a new fence it’s important to always use a reputable, licensed, and insured contractor. Some people try to cut costs by using unlicensed contractors, but this can end up being a major issue if any problems happen during the installation or down the line. In this post, we’ll go over the main reasons why you should always use a licensed and insured fence contractor.

There’s a lot to consider when weighing the pros and cons of a wood fence versus a chain link fence. We’ve tried to make the process easier for you by diving deeper into some of the areas of consideration.
